channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Sensational Raducanu storms to US Open title
item.description: Emma Raducanu ends Britain's 44-year wait for a women's Grand Slam singles champion as she beats Leylah Fernandez to win the US Open.

item.title: Queen praises Raducanu's 'outstanding' performance
item.description: The Queen leads the congratulations to Emma Raducanu after the 18-year-old Briton clinches the US Open title with victory against Leylah Fernandez.

item.title: Emma Raducanu's hometown celebrates US Open win
item.description: The 18-year-old tennis star from Bromley, London, is Britain's first women's Grand Slam singles champion since 1977.

item.title: Afghanistan: Pen Farthing 'so happy' as rescue workers escape
item.description: Staff at his animal shelter successfully crossed from Afghanistan to Pakistan, says Pen Farthing.

item.title: Great North Run 2021: Thousands set for event's return
item.description: The world's biggest half-marathon returns for its 40th running after 2020's hiatus due to Covid.

item.title: M1 crash: Mum accused of killing children might alter appearance, say police
item.description: Mary McCann is wanted by police after two of her children died in a crash on the M1.

item.title: Photographer's images 'like ghosts coming out the mist'
item.description: Guy Bellingham uses a 170-year-old technique to produce striking photos in remarkable detail.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Plane protest over sex assault claim
item.description: A plane showing support for a woman who accused the player of rape flies over Old Trafford.

item.title: Didsbury Mosque: Police investigate fire as hate crime
item.description: Mosque leaders says they are "so grateful" to neighbours who tried to put out the blaze with coats.

item.title: Six men arrested in Â£160m cocaine haul off Plymouth coast
item.description: A British man is among six arrested on a luxury yacht carrying more than two tonnes of cocaine.

item.title: Finsbury Park mosque attacker fears eye loss after prison stabbing
item.description: The Finsbury Park mosque attacker was stabbed by an inmate while serving a life sentence for murder.

item.title: Worthing attack: Boys charged after man suffers life-changing injuries
item.description: The victim spent months in hospital and is now in a specialist rehabilitation facility.

item.title: 'We had tickets for Twin Towers tour on 9/11'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: West Midlands Police apologises for failing domestic abuse victim
item.description: Suzanne Van Hagen's family say they have fought for more than eight years to get the truth.

item.title: Covid: The Chelmsford bench telling women's stories of the pandemic
item.description: Pippa Bloom, who had to shield due to Covid, says sharing her experience was "almost therapeutic".

item.title: Leeds urban farm helps young people grow fresh food
item.description: Young people in Leeds are working with a charity to grow fresh produce and learn new skills.

item.title: Girl, 13, raises Â£26k for Alder Hey hospital in promise to sister
item.description: Jess, 13, says she wanted to support the hospital after its staff supported her through her grief.

item.title: Manager 'sickened' by alleged abuse of goalkeeper
item.description: Alleged racial abuse of Colchester keeper Shamal George during their game at Barrow is 'sickening', says U's boss Hayden Mullins.

item.title: Liverpool arms fair: Corbyn and Peake join protest
item.description: The former Labour leader joined protesters calling for Liverpool to cancel the event.

item.title: Driver given 19 fines from city she did not visit
item.description: Ruth Costello, from West Sussex, is receiving the fines despite never driving in Birmingham.

item.title: Bristol petrol station siege: Man charged with attempted murder
item.description: A 52-year-old man is accused of attempted murder after a stabbing at a petrol station in Bristol.

item.title: Masked man reported spying on Claverham couple at night
item.description: Police are patrolling a village in Somerset amid reports of a man spying at a window late at night.

item.title: Ronaldo was 'super nervous' before two-goal Man Utd return
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo was "super nervous" before scoring twice on his Manchester United return - as boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says he has allowed fans to "dream" again.

item.title: Chelsea 3-0 Aston Villa: 'It's my dream since I was 11' - Lukaku finally scores at Stamford Bridge
item.description: Romelu Lukaku scores his first goal at Stamford Bridge as Chelsea beat Aston Villa to maintain their unbeaten start.

item.title: Hamilton to start fourth at Italian Grand Prix as Verstappen takes pole
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen will start the Italian Grand Prix from pole position with Lewis Hamilton down in fourth.

item.title: US Open 2021: Joe Salisbury and Desirae Krawczyk win mixed doubles title
item.description: Joe Salisbury becomes the first Briton to win two doubles titles at a Grand Slam in the Open era at the US Open.

item.title: Arsenal 1-0 Norwich City: Aubameyang scores winner as Arsenal beat Norwich
item.description: Arsenal lift the pressure on manager Mikel Arteta as they secure their first points of the Premier League season with victory over Norwich City at Emirates Stadium.
